name: contentiousness
content:

the fact of being contentious (= causing or likely to cause disagreement): The debate highlights the contentiousness of the plan. The book's contentiousness is part of the reason why it's such a great read.
disagreement and argument: There has been increasing contentiousness between the two politicians.
More examplesFewer examplesthe contentiousness of the issue of gun controlThe four-hour hearing underscored the contentiousness of the issue.The contentiousness began brewing in January 2012.He is notorious for his contentiousness in contract negotiation.The level of contentiousness between the political parties has made finding solutions to problems even more difficult.
